frameDefinitions: This frame contains (transparent ) nouns that are Units of measurement for time.
The Noise_maker is an artifact used to produce sound, especially for musical effect.
The words in this frame describe a period of time, as opposed to a point in time.
A Protagonist is in the dynamic, maintained state of being alive or has exited this state.

The Attaching frame covers two situations: a scene in which somebody causes one thing to be physically connected to something else; or a scene in which somebody causes two things to be connected to each other.
Words in this frame name the different parts of the calendric cycle, both man-made and natural.
frameExamples: The final total was 606, scored in only 10 <t><fex name='Unit'>hours</fex></t> of excellent batsmanship.
The best <t>time</t> of year for planting tends to be fairly regular.
The robber <t>tied</t> Harry to the chair.
Jo's mother will visit on this coming <t>Tuesday</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: The number of <fen>Unit</fen>s of the measured entity.
The standardized quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured.
The activity or state that takes place during the period of time under discussion.
This role identifies the entity or substance that is designed to produce sound.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>State</fen>'s duration.  In this frame, the duration can be inexact.
An ongoing state whose duration can be measured.
<fen>Protagonist</fen> identifies the being or entity that is  dead or alive.
This role identifies the <fen>Figure</fen> or form being described by the target.
The time in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is dead or alive.

The <fen>Agent</fen> manipulates an object. <fen>Agent</fen> typically refers to animate beings, but is also extended to mechanical and other inanimate objects.  It is most frequently expressed as the external argument of verbs.
This role identifies the <fen>Item</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches to the <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the location to which an <fen>Item</fen> is attached.
The <fen>Connector</fen> forms the bond that maintains the <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen> in a fixed position; it is usually expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.
This role identifies the plural <fen>Items</fen> that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects an <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen>.
<fen>Relative_time</fen> is used for the word or words that locate the time with respect to an identifiable reference point.
<fen>Whole</fen> is used for the larger unit of which the target word names a part.
The calendric unit that is denoted. LUs in this frame all denote the <fen>Unit</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The ads had been absorbed into her brain during <fex>many</fex> <fex>hours</fex> of television watching.
Seven <fex>hours</fex> of torrential rain reduced the pitch to a lake.
He had to listen to almost two <fex>hours</fex> <fex>of complaints</fex>.
<fex>He was a great actor</fex> in his time.
<fex>The robber</fex> tied Harry to the chair.
The robber tied <fex>Harry</fex> to the chair.
The robber tied Harry <fex>to the chair</fex>.
The robber tied Harry to the chair  <fex>with a rope</fex>.
The robber tied Harry to the chair <fex>at midnight</fex>.
The robber tied Harry to the chair <fex>in the basement</fex>.
Jo's mother will visit <fex> this coming</fex> Tuesday.
Jo fled in the early morning <fex>of  Sunday December 15</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Representation of the People Act
the Minister for Women and Equalities
the National Union of Women's Suffrage Societies
Deputy Mayor for Culture and Creative Industries
the Women's Votes Centenary Grant Scheme
